page.title: 03The Brecknock Arms
page.content: The Brecknock Arms is situated in the centre of Bells Yew Green opposite a small village green. When the building was first erected in{1880}it was a house and the original pub was on the Green. This was soon knocked down and the house was converted into the{village pub.} The landlord has been there five months and he enjoys being a landlord. It is his first pub. The{busiest times}are Friday night, and Saturday and Sunday in the evenings, especially after cricket matches in the summer. Cricket clubs have meetings in the bar sometimes. The{services}that the pub provides are morning coffee, drinks, lunches and evening meals. The customers come from{Bells Yew Green, Frant and {Tunbridge Wells.} The landlord said that{smoking}has decreased recently.
